question: Question_03_(b)
statement:
\textbf{Short-Answer Questions}. Questions 1-4 are short-answer
questions. Put your answers in the boxes provided. \textbf{Simplify your
answers as much as possible, and show your work}. Each question is worth
3 marks, but not all questions are of equal difficulty.

If $4x-9 \leq f(x) \leq x^2 -4x + 7$ for $x \geq 0$, find
$\lim_{x \to 4}f(x)$
sols:
Following the advice of the hint since

$\lim_{x \to 4}(4x-9) = 4(4)-9 = 16-9 = 7$

and

$\lim_{x \to 4}(x^{2}-4x+7) = (4)^{2}-4(4)+7 = 16-16+7 = 7$

As these two limits are the same and our function $f(x)$ is bounded
below and above by the two functions above, we have that
$\lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7$ by the squeeze theorem.
hints:
This question looks ready for an application of the squeeze theorem
which states if functions \emph{f},\emph{g},\emph{h} are such that

$g(x) \leq f(x) \leq h(x)$

and if $\lim_{x \to a}g(x) = L = \lim_{x \to a}h(x)$, then
$\lim_{x \to a}f(x)= L$.
